section.title: about mysql
section.para: MySQLmysql is a database server that understands Structured Query Language (SQLSQL). MySQL was developed by the Swedish Company MySQL AB. The first release was in 1995. In 2008 MySQL AB was bought by Sun Microsystems (which is now owned by Oracle).

MySQL is very popular for websites in combination with PHPPHP and Apache (the M in LAMPLAMP servers), but mysql is also used in organizations with huge databases like Facebook, Flickr, Google, Nokia, Wikipedia and Youtube.

section.title: installing mysql
section.para: On Debian/Ubuntu you can use aptitude install mysql-serveraptitude(8) to install the mysql server and client. On this particular system the -R switch is used to avoid installation of apparmor and exim4 (both are recommended but not required for mysql-server).
To verify the installed version, use dpkg -ldpkg(1) on Debian/Ubuntu. This screenshot shows version 5.0 installed.
